review: I can definitely be labeled as an Apple junkie and generally have high regard for most of their products.  Sadly, the Apple TV doesn't reach the same high level of performance as the iPhone and iPad products.  After about three months, I converted from the Apple TV to a Roku 3 and have been very happy with the change.  The Roku simply gives you more channels, has a better interface, is faster, is simply easier to use.  I did enjoy being able to project my iPad or iPhone onto a TV screen using Airplay and Apple TV, but unfortunately, the only way that functionality works is when you are on your home network.  You cannot travel with an Apple TV and expect to use it in a hotel.  You can use your phone as a personal hotspot to establish a network and gain all of the Apple TV capabilities, but you will burn through your data plan very quickly.  If you try to establish your own network using a mobile router then you will quickly find that almost none of your Apple content is authorized to play.  All in all, this was biggest disappointment I have experienced with an Apple product.  Go with a Roku, you'll be much happier.
